unnormalised: Electricity bills in Mumbai are giving everyone a shock, literally! Seems like Adani Electricity decided to prepone Diwali celebrations by jacking up rates by almost 15% in some areas. My neighbour, Mrs. Sharma, was complaining her bill went from ₹2500 last month to ₹2900 this month. And she barely used the AC!

unnormalised: Talk about bad timing, right? With the monsoon playing hide-and-seek and the humidity levels touching 80%, everyone's cranking up their fans and coolers. A report from last week suggests the average household consumption in July surged to 350 units, up from 280 units in June. That's a steep climb!
normalised: Talk about bad timing, right? With the monsoon playing hide and seek and the humidity levels touching eighty percent, everyone's cranking up their fans and coolers. A report from last week suggests the average household consumption in July surged to three hundred and fifty units, up from two hundred and eighty units in June. That's a steep climb!

unnormalised: Experts are saying the increase is due to a combination of factors, including increased coal prices and higher demand during the monsoon season. Plus, the base tariff itself saw a revision of around 5% approved by the regulatory body. So basically, double whammy for the common man.
normalised: Experts are saying the increase is due to a combination of factors, including increased coal prices and higher demand during the monsoon season.
